snippet: A new study suggests that Alzheimer’s causes six times as many deaths as the official statistics would indicate.
abstract: Editorial notes study in journal Neurology suggesting that Alzheimer's disease was underlying cause of 500,000 deaths in 2010, rather than 84,000 deaths as previously thought; holds burden disease places on caregivers is likely to increase as people live to more advanced ages; calls for more research into ways to treat and prevent disease.
lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that Alzheimer’s causes six times as many deaths as the official statistics would indicate.
